name: painting texture
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
Paint with mouse. SPACE to erase.
As often, painting a uv field rather than directly splatting texture elements gives a far better result.
Try other textures ( lines #9-11).
NB: the shader doesn't need to run to work, and indeed even better that way ;-)
common_code:
#define R    iResolution.xy
#define T(U) texelFetch( iChannel0, ivec2(U), 0 )
buffer_a_code:
#define keyDown(a)    ( texelFetch(iChannel3,ivec2(a,0),0).x > 0.)

void mainImage( out vec4 O, vec2 u )
{
    O = iFrame<1 || keyDown(32)                  // init:
          ? u==vec2(.5) ? vec4(.5*R/R.y,0,0)     //   pos in texture, prev mouse pos
                        : O*0.                   //   reset drawing
          :               T(u);                  // current drawing
    
    float i = T(vec2(1)).w,                      // current layer id
          a = step(length(iMouse.wy),10.),       // demo mode
          m = a==0. ? iMouse.z : 1.,             // mouse states
          s = a==0. ? iMouse.w : ( iFrame%20==0 ? 1. : -1. ),
          e = .03;
    vec2  U = ( 2.*u - R ) / R.y,                // pixel position
          M = a==0.
                ? ( 2.* iMouse.xy - R ) / R.y    // mouse position
                : .7*R/R.y*cos(iTime*vec2(1,2.71)+vec2(0,11)), // demo mode
          D = M - T(0).zw,                       // mouse displacement       
          d = normalize(D + 1e-9);               // normalize
    mat2  r = mat2(d.x,d.y,-d.y,d.x);            // mouse frame related to displacement

    
    if (m>0.)
        if (u==vec2(.5)) { O.xy += D*r; if(O.zw != M ) O.zw = M; } // current location in texture
        else if (u==vec2(1.5) && s>0. )  O.w++;  // new paint layer
        else if (s<0.) // && length(D)>0. )
            if( length(U-M)<.1+e && O.z != i )   // layer overlap: replace
                O = vec4( T(0).xy + (U-M)*r , i, 1);
            else
            O += smoothstep(e,-e,length(U-M)-.1) // splat new uv neighborhood
              *  vec4( T(0).xy + (U-M)*r ,0,1);  // cumulates weight               
           // *  texture(iChannel1, 2.*( T(0).xy + (U-M)*r ) ); // variant: directly splat texture
}

#define rot(a)      mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))                      // rotation 
#define d(q,n,t,s)  .04* sin( n *atan(q.z,q.x)+ t* 10.*iTime + s )    // dents
#define T(T,s)      t = min(t, max( max( length(r)-1., .9-length(r)) ,  max( r.y, -r.y + d(r,32.,T,s)) -.05 )) // ring
//#define T(T,s)      t = min(t, max( max( length(r)-1., .9-length(r)) ,  abs(r.y) + d(r,32.,T,s) -.05 ))      // variant
#define g(T,s) t = min(t, max( max( length(r.yz)-.38 -d(r.yxz,12.,T,s) , .3 - length(r.yz) ), abs(r.x+.95) -.03 ) ) // satellite gear     

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t=9.,T, s=1.57;
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(vec3(U+U, -12.*R.y) - R),          // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,0,20), q,r,                           // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? 6.*iMouse.xyz/R -3.
              :  vec3( 1,.5,0) * cos(.3*iTime + vec3(0,11,0)); 
    p += sqrt(R.y/18.) * texelFetch(iChannel0,ivec2(U)%1024,0).x * D; // jitter against pseudo-shading banding
          
    for ( O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.01 )         // march scene
        q = p, // t = 9.,
        q.yz *= rot(-M.y),                                 // rotations
        q.xz *= rot(-M.x-1.57), 
        r = q,     r.y = abs(r.y)-1., T( sign(q.y), s),    // rings
        r = q.yzx, r.y = abs(r.y)-1., T(-sign(q.z),-s),   
        T = sign(q.x), q.x =  -abs(q.x),
        r = q, r.y = abs(r.y)-.55,  g( T*sign(q.y), s),    // satellite gears  
        r = q, r.z = abs(r.z)-.55,  g(-T*sign(q.z),-s),

        p += .5*t*D;                                       // step forward = dist to obj          

   O *= O*O*1.5;                                           // color scheme
}

              :  vec3( 1,.5,0) * cos(.3*iTime + vec3(0,11,0));

image_code:
/*
Things to try out (need recompile and reset):
    - Input waveforms (cw-pulse, cw, pulse)
    - Switch visualized field (v variable in mainImage)
    - Wavelengths (f variable in _step)
    - Pipe shapes (initialization in update)

Buffer:
    .x radius of pipe
    .y mass density "m" contained in this pipe element
    .z mass flux "f" into this pipe element from the left

Using short notation for derivatives: for fn(a, b)
    fn_a (a, b) == d  fn(a, b) / d a
    fn_b (a, b) == d  fn(a, b) / d b
    fn_ab(a, b) == d fn(a, b) / d a / d b

Models an acoustic wave in a pipe:
    x          : L
    t          : T
    c          : L/T
    damping    : 1/T
    area(x)    : L
    mass(x, t) : M/L
    flux(x, t) : M/T

This assumes that the sound pressure level and flow velocity is small, so that "c" can be considered constant.

Problems:
    - Stability issues when using more than one buffer. (off by one?, precision?)

Code:
    mass_t(x, t) : M/L/T =
        - flux_x(x, t)

    density  (x, t) : M/L =
          (mass  (x, t) : M/L) / (area(x) : L)
    density_x(x, t) : M/L =
          (mass_x(x, t) : M/L) / (area(x)  : L)
        - (mass  (x, t) : M/L ) / (area(x) : L) * (area_x(x) : L)

    effective_mass_x(x, t) : M/L
        = density_x(x, t) * area(x)
        = (mass_x (x, t) : M/L)
        - (density(x, t) : M/L) * (area_x(x) : L)

    flux_t(x, t) : M/T =
        - (effective_mass_x(x, t) : M/L) * (c : L/T)
        - (flux(x, t) : M/T) * (damping : 1/T)

Interesting:
    For a settled one-way wave without damping, without sources, without sinks and a fixed cross-section:
        (mass : M/L) is proportional to (-flux : M/T) or (+flux : M/T)
    Basically, you can measure distances using either length or time with "c" as the proportionality constant.
    This get's really obvious when applying the constraints and multiplying mass with "c":

        mass_t(x, t) = -     flux_x(x, t)
        flux_t(x, t) = -     mass_x(x, t) * c
                     = - sym_mass_x(x, t) * c

        sym_mass  (x, t) : M/T  =   mass(x, t) * c
        sym_flux  (x, t) : M/T  =   flux(x, t)

        -- same unit, same update !!
        sym_mass_t(x, t) : M/T = - flux_x(x, t) * c
        sym_flux_t(x, t) : M/T = - mass_x(x, t) * c

*/

void mainImage(out vec4 C, vec2 O)
{
    ivec2 I = ivec2(O);
    int y = int(O.y / iResolution.y * float(npipes));
    float Oy = O.y - (float(y) + .5) * iResolution.y / float(npipes);
    
    vec4 h = texelFetch(iChannel0, ivec2(I.x, y), 0);
    C = vec4(0);
    float r = h.x - abs(Oy);
    float v = h.y; // mass
    //v = h.z / c; // flux
    if (r > 0.)
    {
        if (true)
        //if (false)
        {
            C = mix(C, vec4(0, .1, 1, 1), clamp(-v, 0., 1.));
            C = mix(C, vec4(1, .2, 0, 1), clamp(+v, 0., 1.));
        }
        else
            C = mix(C, vec4(0,  1, 0, 1), clamp(abs(v), 0., 1.));
    }
    C = mix(C, vec4(1), clamp((1. + .3 * abs(dFdx(r))) - abs(r), 0., 1.));
    C = sqrt(C);
}

// Borrowed from "Infinite 3D Grid Planes" by peepsalot:
// https://www.shadertoy.com/view/Ndy3Rm
float plane( in vec3 ro, in vec3 rd, in vec4 p ){
    return -(dot(ro,p.xyz)+p.w)/dot(rd,p.xyz);
}

float grid(in vec2 p, in vec2 dpdx, in vec2 dpdy, float N){
    const float scl = 0.5;
    vec2 w = max(abs(dpdx), abs(dpdy));
    vec2 a = p + 1.0 / N - w; // see 
    vec2 b = p - w;
    vec2 i = clamp(
      ( floor(a) + min(fract(a) * N, 1.0)
       -floor(b) - min(fract(b) * N, 1.0)
      ) / (N*w)
      , vec2(0), vec2(1));
    return (1.0 - i.x) * (1.0 - i.y);
}

float grid_lookup(in vec3 ro, in vec3 rd, float resDist, in vec4 pln, float scale, float lineRatio){
    float t = plane(ro, rd, pln);
    if (t > 0.0 && t<resDist){
        vec3 p = (ro + t * rd);
        vec2 uv = scale*(p.yz * pln.x + p.xz * pln.y + p.xy * pln.z);
        return clamp(1.0 - grid(uv, dFdx(uv), dFdy(uv), 2.0 * lineRatio), 0.0, 1.0);
    } else {
        return 0.0;
    }
}

// https://iquilezles.org/articles/intersectors
// infinite cylinder defined by a base point cb, a normalized axis ca and a radious cr
vec2 cylIntersect( in vec3 ro, in vec3 rd, in vec3 cb, in vec3 ca, float cr ){
    vec3  oc = ro - cb;
    float card = dot(ca,rd);
    float caoc = dot(ca,oc);
    float a = 1.0 - card*card;
    float b = dot( oc, rd) - caoc*card;
    float c = dot( oc, oc) - caoc*caoc - cr*cr;
    float h = b*b - a*c;
    if( h<0.0 ) return vec2(-1.0); //no intersection
    h = sqrt(h);
    return vec2(-b-h,-b+h)/a;
}
